definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword

sentences.english: The foil is a thrusting weapon with no cutting edge.
sentences.chinese: 花剑，没有劈杀用的剑刀，是刺戳用兵器。

sentences.english: The study examined influential factors of foil fencers decision-making in simulating fencing situation.
sentences.chinese: 研究了影响花剑运动员决策速度和准确性的因素。

sentences.english: In foil and saber, only the attacking fencer can score a point.
sentences.chinese: 在花剑和佩剑比赛中，只有进攻方才能得分。

sentences.english: Actually, I am a competitive foil fencer.
sentences.chinese: 实际上我是个花剑比赛选手。

sentences.english: Italy's women's foil team is stacked with the top three fencers in the world.
sentences.chinese: 意大利女子花剑队有三名世界顶级选手压阵。

definition: double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
narcissus/daffodil/legendary aquatic immortal/refers to those buried at sea/person who wanders abroad and does not return
spray (sprig of a plant with blossoms)/cuttlefish (on dining menus)/(literary) beautiful woman
handle or shaft (of an axe etc)/(of a flower, leaf or fruit) stem/sth that affords an advantage to an opponent/classifier for knives or blades
